title: The five stories that explain why Arch Manning was built for this moment
content: How did the Texas quarterback learn to handle the pressure he's facing as the most famous college football player in the country?

title: Intel on college football's top 2025 quarterbacks
content: There are interesting QBs all over the country. We look at what they do well and how opponents will stop them.

title: Sources: Chiefs' Rice accepts 6-game suspension
content: Chiefs wide receiver Rashee Rice has accepted a six-game suspension for violating the NFL's personal conduct policy, sources told ESPN, and will start serving the suspension at the beginning of the season.

title: Patriots claim QB DeVito, to release WR Bourne
content: The Patriots claimed former New York Giants quarterback Tommy DeVito off waivers and plan to release veteran wide receiver Kendrick Bourne on Wednesday after talks to trade him didn't come to fruition, sources told ESPN.

title: Ravens making Hamilton highest-paid NFL safety
content: All-Pro safety Kyle Hamilton and the Ravens have reached agreement on a four-year, $100.4 million extension that is the largest deal for a safety in NFL history, his agents told ESPN.

title: Bradley doesn't pick himself for Ryder Cup squad
content: Keegan Bradley did not call his own name for the United States Ryder Cup team, deciding against becoming the event's first playing captain in 62 years.

title: Source: NFL relaxes Brady broadcast restrictions
content: Tom Brady is getting some additional access in his role as a Fox broadcaster, including being allowed to attend production meetings this season, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Texans unsure of Mixon's status for '25 season
content: Texans general manager Nick Caserio was noncommittal Wednesday when asked about the status of Pro Bowl running back Joe Mixon for the 2025 season.

title: Cutler gets four-day sentence in DWI plea deal
content: Jay Cutler will spend several days in the Williamson County (Tennessee) Jail as part of a plea deal he took stemming from a drunken driving arrest in October 2024.

title: Back up North: Thielen returns to Vikes in trade
content: The Vikings and Panthers are finalizing a trade for wide receiver Adam Thielen to return to Minnesota.

title: ❤️ Sports world reacts to Kelce-Swift engagement
content: The Kansas City Chiefs tight end and pop star announced their engagement in a joint Instagram post on Tuesday.

title: Graziano: Don't be surprised if these 32 things happen, from an MVP run to rookies who could star
content: Jordan Love in the MVP mix? Emeka Egbuka leading all Bucs receivers? Colts winning the AFC South? We have 32 outside-the-box things to watch.

title: Welcome to 'Milwaukee Community College': How the Brewers built a $115 million juggernaut
content: As small-market Milwaukee rolls along with MLB's best record, everyone wants to know the Brew Crew's secret formula.

title: 25 under 25: Clark, then who? Ranking the best young players
content: Which WNBA players have the most future potential? Caitlin Clark, Paige Bueckers and Angel Reese make our list.

title: The biggest roster moves from all 32 NFL teams: How did each team get to 53 players?
content: With the 2025 season a week away, NFL teams were required to finalize their 53-man rosters. We rounded up every team's cuts here.

title: Arsenal or Chelsea to win Premier League; Estevao better than Gyokeres? Week 2 overreactions
content: After hitting most of our overreaction predictions last season, we're running it back. Expect a new champion in England, some giants in Spain and Germany to drop, and Chelsea's Estevao to have a big year.

title: Contenders and bottom five: Expert predictions for NBA East and West standings
content: The top five seeds, play-in group and bottom five. NBA expert predict where all 30 teams will land in the standings for the 2025-26 NBA season.

title: Runaway MVPs, ROY races? Expert predictions for every major award in 2025-26
content: Can Nikola Jokic claim a fourth MVP? Which rookie will impress? Our panel reveals its award predictions.

title: Wilson, Winston and Dart: Inside the reimagined high-profile Giants QB room
content: This is the group put together in an offseason as undoubtedly a priority to rebuild the quarterback room.

title: Despite a grim diagnosis, a deep connection to Cincinnati kept Dontay Corleone going
content: Blood clots almost derailed Corleone's career, but he's pressing forward with the support of both the town and the university.

title: 10-team mock draft: Jonathan Taylor goes early in Round 2, QB value late
content: It's peak draft season. Our ESPN Fantasy crew got one more practice run in to get ready for the real thing.

title: Finding the overs: Why the prop lines offer value on Evans, Hunter, Harrison and more
content: Another 1,000-yard season for Mike Evans? Travis Kelce to surprise? Rookies to watch? Eric Karabell offers the lines on overs that are appealing.

title: College football betting: Breaking down the Heisman and national champion odds, top bets
content: Pamela Maldonado tracks the odds for the Heisman Trophy and the national champion and her best value bets.

title: A contract, designer wardrobe and UFC win: Inside Baisangur Susurkaev's best week
content: Baisangur Susurkaev entered the week of Aug. 12 unknown and ended it Dana White's "favorite fighter."

title: Way-too-early UFC at the White House fight card
content: Let's take an early look at a UFC event at the White House in 2026 that Dana White says is "going to happen."

title: Welcome to Necaxa: Rob, Ryan and Eva Longoria bring the Wrexham playbook to Mexico
content: Rob Mac and Ryan Reynolds have already written a Hollywood script with Wrexham's rise. With Eva Longoria, can they do it again with Necaxa in Mexico?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United set £50m fee for Garnacho's Chelsea move
content: Manchester United want a £50m transfer fee to let winger Alejandro Garnacho leave for Chelsea. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: From market rate to intermediaries, seven truths about the transfer market
content: The big clubs have the spending power and influence, but there are plenty of ways teams like Genoa can keep pace.

title: New USMNT roster a head-scratcher: Is Pochettino wasting a chance for World Cup prep?
content: The USMNT only has four more camps before the 2026 FIFA World Cup begins, but coach Mauricio Pochettino's latest roster feels like a wasted opportunity.

title: After skipping Gold Cup, Musah has big plans for USMNT in a World Cup year
content: United States international Yunus Musah speaks to James Olley about his his hopes for next year's World Cup hosts.

title: Reranking every MLB farm system from 1 to 30
content: The busiest time of the year for adding prospects has passed. Here's how every organization stacks up now.

title: Way-Too-Early Bracketology: Is this (finally) the year of the Big Ten?
content: For a change, the Big Ten has both quantity and quality to send to the Dance. Can its 25-year title drought finally end?

title: NASCAR's playoff king, Joey Logano, wants derided format to stay
content: The is a vocal crowd within NASCAR unhappy with the the playoff format. Not Joey Logano, though, who has come to thrive in the biggest moments.

title: Fantasy baseball pickups: Power, speed and a must-add returning ace
content: Here are the players you should claim off the waiver wire, including some pitchers returning from injury.

title: AAP Leader Says Central Agency Tried to Change Statement, BJP Calls It 'Drama'
content: AAP Delhi state president Saurabh Bharadwaj has accused the Enforcement Directorate or ED of manipulating his statement during yesterday's raid at his residence.

title: 2 Children Die In Firing During Mass At US School, Shooter Kills Self
content: A shooting occurred Wednesday morning at a Minneapolis Catholic school, Minnesota governor's said. Governor Tim Walz called the shooting "horrific."

title: Shoot-At-Sight Order In Assam's Dhubri District To Continue During Durga Puja: Himanta Sarma
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday said that the shoot-at-sight orders at night, enforced since June 13 in Dhubri district, will remain in force during Durga Puja in view of fresh security concerns along the India-Bangladesh border.

title: Russian, Chinese Submarines Conduct 1st-Ever Joint Patrol In Pacific Region
content: The Russian and Chinese navies have carried out their first-ever joint patrol in the Pacific region, according to a media report on Wednesday.

title: Minneapolis Gunman Shot Through Church Windows At Children: Police Chief
content: A shooter opened fire at Minneapolis Catholic school on Wednesday, killing two children and injuring 17 other people before killing himself, officials said. The children who died were 8 and 10.

title: "Kids Were Literally Praying...": Mayor's Emotional Outburst After US Shooting
content: A gunman opened fire at a Minneapolis Catholic school, where children were praying, killing two and injuring 17 others before killing himself, officials said. Of the 17 injured, 14 were children.

title: 36 Killed In Floods, Landslides As Jammu Sees Highest Rainfall Since 1910
content: The rains and thunderstorm that have been ravaging Jammu for two days -- causing floods, landslides and massive damage -- appear to be gradually weakening.

title: US Thanks CBI For Busting Illegal Call Centre That Duped Its Citizens Of Millions
content: The United States thanked the CBI on Wednesday for "partnership and support" in dismantling a cybercrime syndicate that had siphoned off over Rs 350 crore from its citizens since 2023.

title: Denmark Apologises For Forced Birth Control Scandal In Greenland
content: Denmark's prime minister on Wednesday presented a long-awaited apology to the victims of Denmark's forced contraception campaign in Greenland, lifting a key point of tension with its autonomous territory.

title: MK Stalin's Photo With Rahul Gandhi, Tejashwi Yadav Sparks DMK-BJP Face-Off
content: As DMK leader and Tamil Nadu MK Stalin joined Rahul Gandhi and Tejashwi Yadav in the 'voter Adhikar yatra' on Wednesday to protest against the contentious Special Intensive Revision (SIR) in Bihar.

title: Man Arrested For Recording Bathing Women At UP Hostel
content: A man who had been recording bathing women at a hostel in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh has been arrested, said the police.

title: Video: Protesters Block Congress MP's Car Over MLA Accused Of Harassment
content: Congress MP Shafi Parambil and DYFI activists engaged in a verbal altercation on Wednesday after the Left-wing youth outfit members blocked his vehicle and allegedly shouted abusive slogans against him near Vatakara in Kerala.

title: "Theft Of Crores": Delhi Congress Chief On Phasing Out Old Vehicles
content: The Delhi Congress has alleged a Rs 100-crore scam in the scrapping of end-of-life vehicles and demanded a Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) probe into what it described as large-scale corruption involving enforcement agencies.

title: 55-Year-Old Rajasthan Woman Gives Birth To 17th Child
content: In a rare incident, the 55-year-old Rekha Kalbelia, wife of Kavara Ram Kalbelia, gave birth to her 17th child at the Community Health Centre in Jhadol block of Rajasthan's Udaipur district.

title: Jammu Kashmir Flash Floods News Highlights: 36 Killed In Record-breaking Rain
content: Jammu Kashmir Flash Floods News LIVE: Several people are reportedly injured in a massive landslide that occurred near Inderprastha Bhojnalaya at Adhkwari.

title: Denmark Summons US Envoy Over Covert 'Influence' Operations In Greenland
content: The US envoy to Denmark was summoned on Wednesday after reports of attempted interference in Greenland, which is a part of Danish autonomous territory that US President Donald Trump has been trying to take over since his return to office.

title: Coimbatore's Textile, MSME Sector Seek Relief After US Tariff Hike, Cite Covid
content: The MSME and textile industry in Tamil Nadu's Tirupur and Coimbatore could face a wipeout, with the 50 per cent tariff imposed by Donald Trump kicking in.

title: J&K, Uttarakhand, Himachal: Why It Is Raining So Much In The North This Year
content: Jammu has broken all records post-1910 over the last two days and Udhampur has received 629.4 mm of rainfall over 24 hours -- almost as much as Delhi receives in the whole monsoon.

title: "Time To Show Understanding Of National Interest": Centre On Tariffs, Risks
content: The immediate impact of recent US tariffs on Indian exports may appear limited but their secondary and tertiary effects on the economy pose challenges that must be addressed, the finance ministry said in a report on Wednesday.

title: Ukraine Sees "Priceless" Digital Battlefield Data As Key To Western Support
content: Ukraine is looking at how to share battlefield data with allies, the country's deputy prime minister said, calling the vast trove of stored information one of Kyiv's "cards" to strengthen its position as it negotiates support from friendly countries.

title: US citizenship: Neighbours, boss to have a say? Applicants to face tougher scrutiny
content: An internal policy memorandum issued recently by the US Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) states that these personal investigations, also known as neighbourhood investigations or watch, cover the vicinity of an alien’s (foreign national’s) place of residence and employment and include at least the 5-year period prior to the filing of the alien’s naturalization (citizenship) application.

title: Trump's tariffs: India pivots toward China and Russia - should US be worried?
content: Amidst rising tensions with the West due to tariffs, India's participation in the SCO summit signals a strategic recalibration. This move, highlighted by Modi's visit to China and strengthened ties with Russia, challenges the US-led order. It reflects India's pursuit of strategic autonomy and a more balanced geopolitical approach, potentially reshaping global alliances.

title: US church shooting: At least 2 children dead, 20 hurt; gunman neutralised
content: A shooting at Annunciation Church in Minneapolis resulted in two fatalities and at least 20 injuries. President Trump acknowledged the incident, offering prayers and confirming the FBI's rapid response. Authorities are investigating reports of a potential bomb within the church, while urging residents to avoid the area as emergency services assist victims and the shooter is contained.

title: Trade deal: India indicates no compromise on red lines; 'deal dependent on ...'
content: India and the US are engaged in trade pact discussions, navigating sensitive issues to reach an agreement. India is firm on protecting its farmers, fishermen, and small businesses, while the US seeks lower tariffs and greater market access.

title: Meta’s AI bet; Trump to Zuckerberg: ‘What the hell kind of plant is that?’
content: During a cabinet meeting, US President Donald Trump announced Meta's plan to invest $50 billion in a new AI data center, potentially the world's largest. While Meta hasn't confirmed the exact figure, the facility will support ambitious AI initiatives, including the Superintelligence Labs division.

title: Five episodes that soured the Trump-Modi bromance
content: The Trump-Modi friendship, once hailed as a 'bromance,' faced several challenges during Trump's presidency. Key disagreements arose from Trump's offer to mediate in Kashmir, misunderstandings during meetings, and trade disputes. Ultimately, the relationship soured due to perceived slights and conflicting priorities, culminating in Trump's rejection of a trade deal.

title: Tips to boost energy: Anti-aging influencer shares advice; check these six-steps
content: Tech entrepreneur Bryan Johnson suggests a simple, science-backed routine to combat fatigue and enhance vitality. This routine involves cutting off caffeine by noon, finishing meals by 6 pm, and turning off screens by 9 pm. It also includes breathwork and consistent exercise, aligning with circadian rhythm science to improve sleep and energy levels.

title: 'At end of day ...': US official's big hint as 50% tariffs hit India
content: Despite escalating trade tensions, a top US official expressed optimism about the future of US-India relations. US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent highlighted the strong bond between President Trump and Prime Minister Modi. While dismissing the possibility of the rupee becoming a global reserve currency, India has initiated export promotion programs in 40 key markets.

title: 'Nobody really questions, truth is ... ': World Cup-winning star on Bumrah 'workload' row
content: Balvinder Singh Sandhu defends Jasprit Bumrah's workload management amid criticism, highlighting the physical demands of fast bowling and the double standards faced by bowlers compared to batsmen. Sandhu reveals statistics showing Bumrah's minimal rest periods over the past seven years. Mohammed Kaif also supports Bumrah's T20I comeback, despite fitness concerns raised during the England series.

title: 'Will prove beyond doubt in 6 months': Rahul on his 'vote chori' charge
content: Rahul Gandhi intensified his "vote chori" charge during his Bihar rally, accusing PM Modi, Amit Shah, and the ECI of manipulating elections through a "Gujarat model" of vote theft. He claimed to possess evidence of electoral fraud in multiple states, including Maharashtra, where the ECI allegedly inflated votes favouring the BJP after the Lok Sabha elections.

title: Bill Gates on ‘compulsory’ interview ask; What Microsoft founder answered
content: Bill Gates shared his perspective on handling the salary expectation question during job interviews, advocating for a focus on long-term vision and stock options over immediate cash. In a 2020 mock interview, he emphasized the importance of transparency and trust, signaling confidence in the company's potential.

title: 'No cause for panic': India-US tariff issue manageable, say govt sources
content: Despite the US imposing 50% tariffs on Indian goods, government sources assure there's no need for panic, emphasizing open communication channels to resolve the issue. While some sectors face challenges, India's diversified exports and rising figures in the first four months of this fiscal year mitigate the impact.

title: 'Used to beat me for dowry': Nikki's sis-in-law makes big claim; father replies
content: Following Nikki Bhati's death from alleged immolation, conflicting claims emerge. Nikki's sister-in-law defends the husband and in-laws, accusing Nikki's family of dowry demands and abuse. Nikki's father vehemently denies these counter-allegations. Investigators are revisiting the case, re-examining Nikki's sister's statement to clarify the events leading to her death.

title: 1 ball, 3 sixes, 22 runs! RCB batter pulls off the unthinkable
content: West Indies' Romario Shepherd stunned the CPL 2025, blasting 22 runs off a single legal delivery while playing for Guyana Amazon Warriors against St Lucia Kings. Shepherd's explosive, unbeaten 73 off 34 balls, following his IPL stint with Royal Challengers Bengaluru, powered the Warriors to 202. However, it proved futile as St Lucia Kings won the game with 11 runs to spare.

title: Michael Jordan donated $8.9M to kids after 2015 lawsuit win
content: Michael Jordan won an $8.9 million lawsuit against Dominick's in 2015 for unauthorized use of his name in an advertisement. He donated the entire settlement to 23 Chicago charities supporting children's health, education, and well-being. This case highlights Jordan's commitment to protecting his identity and giving back to the community.

title: Cowboys’ Micah Parsons trade buzz grows as Packers make move
content: Mikah Parsons wants to leave Dallas Cowboys due to contract issues. He told the team on August 1, 2025, that he wanted to quit. Green Bay Packers are interested and made a big offer. They offered draft picks and Rashan Gary. Jerry Jones says Parsons will stay. The Cowboys might not trade him. Everyone is watching what happens next.

title: Nylander hails Tavares as true Leafs leader after $60M loyalty call
content: John Tavares, Toronto Maple Leafs captain, has signed a four-year extension with a significantly reduced wage. This move frees up cap space for the team. William Nylander praised Tavares' leadership and commitment. Tavares expressed his desire to win in Toronto. The team strengthened its defense with the extra cap space.

title: FDA approves updated Covid vaccines with tighter access rules
content: The FDA has approved updated COVID-19 vaccines for the 2025-2026 season, with stricter eligibility rules focusing on older adults and high-risk individuals. Pfizer-BioNTech's shot is for those 65 and older and high-risk individuals aged 5-64, while Moderna's is for high-risk groups 6 months and older, and Novavax is for those 12 and up.

title: Op Sindoor: Rahul claims PM 'halted' strikes 5 hrs after Trump's threat; BJP hits back
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized PM Modi, citing Trump's claim that Modi halted military action against Pakistan within five hours of a 24-hour ultimatum. However, these claims appear dubious, as the US imposed tariffs on India despite the pause in Operation Sindoor. Modi refuted Trump's statements, asserting that no world leader requested the suspension of the operation.

title: India counters US tariffs: Centre plans 40-nation outreach; textile exports in focus
content: In response to US tariffs, India is targeting 40 key markets, including the UK and Japan, to boost textile exports. This diversification strategy aims to position India as a reliable supplier of sustainable textiles. Export Promotion Councils will lead the effort, leveraging FTAs and international trade fairs.

title: Sehwag junior arrives! Aaryavir smashes boundaries for fun
content: Virender Sehwag's son, Aaryavir, debuted in the Delhi Premier League for Central Delhi Kings, opening the batting like his father. The 17-year-old hit impressive boundaries against Navdeep Saini and Rounak Waghela, scoring 22 off 16 balls. Aaryavir shared memories of watching his father play, acknowledging the inspiration he draws from Sehwag's career and understanding his greatness as a player.

title: Ben Griffin snub sparks Ryder Cup row as Bradley opts for veterans over star
content: Rex Hoggard reports that Keegan Bradley, the U.S. Ryder Cup captain, is set to announce his six captain's picks today, with all eyes on Ben Griffin. Despite Griffin's impressive season, including two wins and strong major finishes, Hoggard questions whether Bradley will trust the rookie. Bradley's decision looms as he balances experience and potential in shaping his team.

title: SpaceX gives rare look inside Starlink factory: 70 satellites a week and mini lasers
content: SpaceX is rapidly scaling Starlink production, now manufacturing 70 satellites weekly at its Redmond facility. They've also developed mini lasers for third-party satellite connectivity, tested at 25Gbps over 4,000 km. Starship's upcoming test flight will deploy Starlink simulators, paving the way for larger satellite launches and expanded global internet coverage. A Texas facility produces 15,000 Starlink antenna dishes daily.

title: 'Trade should be bereft of pressure,' says RSS chief; calls wokeism 'big crisis'
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat emphasised self-reliance and using indigenous products, advocating for international engagement by choice, not pressure, aligning with the true spirit of swadeshi. He cautioned against excessive imports that harm local vendors and highlighted the growing fanaticism and the crisis of wokeism in the world, urging a return to Dharma for balance and acceptance of diversity.

title: Inter-faith land transfers in Assam to be probed, says CM Himanta
content: The Assam government will now scrutinise land transfers between people of different faiths, focusing on legality, funding sources, social impact, and national security. This SOP will also apply to NGOs buying land for educational or healthcare institutions. Prime Minister Modi is scheduled to visit Assam on September 8 to inaugurate a bio-refinery and lay foundation stones for infrastructure projects.

title: CBSE announces reforms for LOC submission ahead of Class 10 and 12 board exams 2026
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has introduced major reforms for the 2026 Class 10 and 12 board exams, revamping the List of Candidates (LOC) submission process. Key changes include a two-board exam policy for Class 10, mandatory linking of APAAR IDs for Indian schools, strict data accuracy requirements, and a dedicated portal for Children with Special Needs, enhancing transparency, inclusivity, and operational efficiency.

title: LA Lakers are quietly plotting an aggressive roster change of modern NBA era
content: Los Angeles Lakers are strategizing for the future. The team is focusing on Luka Doncic. LeBron James' contract is ending. Lakers had bench scoring and defensive issues. The team aims to maximize the 2025-26 season. They plan to leverage cap space for star additions. Bolstering defense and depth is crucial.

title: Trump just welcomed 600K Chinese students and MAGA can't keep calm
content: While Trump’s constant delays has earned him the sobriquet TACO (Trump always chickens out), his latest move has made things even more difficult for the MAGA faithful to swallow: greenlighting the entry of 600,000 Chinese students.

title: How can India offset impact of Trump's tariffs? 'Two broad options' explained
content: Faced with 50% tariffs imposed by the US, India can mitigate the impact by boosting domestic consumption, as its internal market absorbs a significant portion of production, says GTRI. Diversifying export destinations through Free Trade Agreements with the EU, UK, and other nations is another viable strategy.

title: Joint effort: CBI, FBI bust major cybercrime network; $40M fraud exposed in crackdown
content: A major cybercrime syndicate, responsible for defrauding US nationals of nearly $40 million through tech-support scams, has been dismantled. The joint operation by India’s CBI and the US FBI led to the arrest of key figures involved in the fraud. This coordinated action highlights the commitment to international cooperation in combating cybercrime.

title: Living things emit a ghostly glow that vanishes at death: Study
content: A 2024 study reveals that living organisms emit an ultraweak light, disappearing upon death. This faint glow, linked to cellular processes and stress, is detectable in mice and plants. The discovery offers potential applications in medical diagnostics, agricultural monitoring, and quantum biology research, unveiling a subtle light signature of life.

title: India issues fresh flood alerts to Pak; warns of 'high probability' risk
content: India has issued flood risk alerts to Pakistan for the Tawi river due to heavy rainfall and dam water release, sources told PTI. Shared on humanitarian grounds amidst tense relations, the alerts warn of potential flooding. Pakistan's Punjab province has evacuated over 1.5 lakh people due to rising water levels from India.

title: 'We can't forget Pahalgam': Sehwag promotes India vs Pak Asia Cup clash, faces backlash
content: The Asia Cup 2025 is embroiled in controversy after Sony Sports Network's promotional video, highlighting the India-Pakistan rivalry, sparked outrage due to heightened tensions following a terror attack. Fans are calling for boycotts, overshadowing India's first major tournament without Kohli and Sharma. Suryakumar Yadav leads a youthful squad in Group A, facing UAE, Oman, and Pakistan.

title: Gaza City to be evacuated? What Israel said
content: An Israeli military spokesperson announced the "inevitable" evacuation of Gaza City amidst intensified operations against Hamas. The UN has warned of a potential famine due to this evacuation plan. Meanwhile, US President Trump plans to discuss post-war Gaza strategies.

title: Thackeray tie-up? Uddhav meets Raj on Ganesh Chaturthi; civic polls in focus
content: Uddhav Thackeray visited cousin Raj Thackeray's residence for Ganesh Chaturthi in Mumbai, fueling speculation of a potential alliance for upcoming civic polls. This marks their third public interaction, following Raj's birthday visit to Uddhav in July. Their renewed bonhomie was also evident during a joint political appearance protesting language policies.

title: 'Turn yourself in boi': Asante Samuel slams Antonio Brown for mocking NFL setback
content: Shilo Sanders' NFL dream faced a setback after the Tampa Bay Buccaneers released him following a preseason ejection for throwing a punch. Antonio Brown then mocked the Sanders family, leading to a heated exchange with Asante Samuel, who referenced Brown's legal issues. The incident highlights the impact of on-field behavior on a player's career.

title: Flood fury grips Punjab: 400 students trapped in school; rescue ops on
content: Around 400 students and staff at Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya in Gurdaspur were stranded due to severe flooding, submerging the school's ground floor. NDRF and army teams were deployed for rescue operations as rivers in Punjab's border districts overflowed due to dam water release, impacting several districts.

title: CWG 2030: Cabinet approves India's bid; Ahmedabad as host city
content: India's Union Cabinet, under Prime Minister Modi, has approved a bid to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games in Ahmedabad. This decision includes signing a Host Collaboration Agreement and providing financial support to Gujarat. The Games, featuring 72 nations, aim to boost tourism, create jobs, and inspire young athletes, utilising facilities like the Narendra Modi Stadium.

title: Chhattisgarh shocker: Man butchers mother; sits near body singing
content: In a shocking incident in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur district, Jeet Ram Yadav brutally murdered his mother with an axe, leaving her body unrecognizable. He then sat near the corpse, singing and threatening anyone who approached. Police faced a four-hour standoff before finally overpowering and arresting Yadav, who appears to be mentally unstable.

title: Asia Cup: Big update on Shubman Gill and Hardik Pandya - details inside
content: India’s T20I vice-captain Shubman Gill has recovered from a viral flu and will undergo training at the BCCI Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru this week. While Gill missed the Duleep Trophy opener, several top cricketers including Kuldeep Yadav, Arshdeep Singh, and Hardik Pandya are also at the CoE for fitness work.

title: Musk reacts to Swift’s engagement to Travis Kelce; offers to father her child
content: Pop culture is buzzing over Taylor Swift's engagement to Travis Kelce, announced with a simple garden photo. Elon Musk reacted with a rocket emoji, referencing SpaceX. Donald Trump offered his well wishes to the couple, praising both Swift and Kelce. As Kelce gears up for the NFL season, wedding plans remain unclear, potentially coinciding with his playoff preparations.

title: Himachal flood fury: Truck disappears in seconds in raging Beas river - watch
content: A pickup truck was swept away by the Beas river in Manali after the road collapsed due to heavy monsoon rains. The IMD has issued a 'red' alert for several districts, forecasting extremely heavy rainfall in the next 48 hours. Connectivity between Mandi and Kullu is severely disrupted due to landslides, and authorities are urging people to avoid unnecessary travel.

title: Bihar polls: Nitish govt minister hounded by mob; chased for 1km, car attacked
content: In Bihar's Nalanda district, Rural Development Minister Shrawan Kumar and JD(U) legislator Krishna Murari Sharan faced villagers' wrath following a road accident that killed nine. Villagers, demanding immediate compensation, chased the minister and MLA for a kilometre after the minister's delayed response. The minister switched vehicles multiple times to escape the angry mob, resulting in injuries to a security officer.

title: 2K Games details MyNBA and MyGM changes in upcoming NBA 2K26
content: 2K Games has revealed improvements to NBA 2K26's management modes, MyNBA and MyGM . players can invite up to 15 friends or make the playoffs available to the public . most actions in these modes are simulated, and developers have invested time and energy in response to community feedback .

title: How Kalen DeBoer looks to make things right in Year 2 at Alabama
content: "it was basically the elephant in the room," says a team meeting . "if you don't want to be here, leave," says the team's head strength coach . a meeting in which coach David Ballou spared nobody in an earsplitting tirade .

title: News: Rangers lose Eovaldi; Alvarez returns for Houston
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . new york Yankees host the Washington Nationals in an interleague tilt . willson Contreras has appealed his six-game suspension .

title: Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as a one-stop shop for all of our best material . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team . create a league and customize league size, scoring and rules to play in the league you want .

title: Four picks to win your finals
content: injuries are influencing rotations around the league, such as the wave of starters missing for the Indiana Fever . it can be frustrating when the stars that helped get you this far are sidelined, but it also creates openings for hidden gems to step up . don't be afraid to take risks as short-term production matters more than name value .

title: Striker moves prompting more striker moves: How top Premier League clubs net out
content: arsenal have signed a striker this summer . the striker was injured against Leeds on saturday . a bigger club, Manchester United, got involved, and sesko went there instead . click here for all the latest arsenal news .

title: How the Fever and four other WNBA teams can clinch playoff spots
content: the 2025 WNBA playoff picture is taking shape . the top teams in the league are fighting for playoff seeding and home-court advantage . five teams, all within four games of each other, are realistically vying for the final three spots .

title: Catch up on NFL cuts, trades and final roster moves
content:
C.J. Stroud joins "First Take" to discuss how the Texans' offensive line has improved as a unit to protect him better in the 2025 NFL season. (1:13) The roster  cut-down deadline  for all  32 teams  for the  2025 NFL season  has passed. Each front office had to trim its active roster to 53 players by 4 p.m. ET, which means there were plenty of cuts, trades, practice squad additions and  roster moves  announced. Good news: We tracked it all for you. Here is the intel, including notable moves and what our reporters heard. There will be no more updates. Quick links: 
 Team-by-team list of cuts 
 Depth charts  |  Trade tracker  |  Trade grades

title: How Kelce has prepared for what could be his final season
content: the Chiefs star tight end is in the final year of his contract . he has spoken about his future with the team through only this season . "i can't go out like that," he says . the chiefs start their season in so Paulo next week .

title: Kamal Haasan bats for self-reliance as Trump’s 50% tariff kicks in
content: The Rajya Sabha MP said the 50% tariffs on our exporters were not about trade, nor about Ukraine but a political cudgel, “aimed at shaking our resolve”.

title: First ever under-lights cricket tournament at militancy-hotbed Pulwama try to heal old wounds
content: The first match between the Royal Goodwill and the Sultan Warriors was a nail-biter, with the final over getting to decide the winner

title: Actor Lakshmi Menon, three others booked for alleged abduction of Kochi techie
content: A senior officer of Kochi City Police confirmed to The Hindu that actor Midhun has been arraigned as the third accused in the case, whose sole name is mentioned in the FIR

title: Amoebic meningoencephalitis: Health dept invokes State Public Health Act
content: So far, 41 cases of amoebic meningoencephalitis have been reported in the State this year, with 18 active cases in hospitals under treatment

title: Disproportionate assets case: High Court stays proceedings against ADGP Kumar
content: ADGP M.R. Ajith Kumar approached the High Court, challenging the Special Court’s rebuffing of the VACB preliminary inquiry report that had exonerated him from any wrongdoing in the case.

title: BJP MLA clashes with Collector over fertilizer shortage in Madhya Pradesh’s Bhind
content: A purported video of the incident has also gone viral on social media, showing Mr. Kushwaha and Mr. Shrivastava engaged in a heated exchange of words at the entrance of the Collector’s residence

title: International trade should happen voluntarily, not under pressure, says Mohan Bhagwat
content: Sangh chief appeals for Indians to opt for swadeshi products on the day the U.S.’s 50% tariff on India kicked in

title: Mother-daughter duo killed, 9 hurt in Virar building collapse; some residents feared trapped
content: The injured have been rushed to various hospitals in the area and Nalasopara, on the outskirts of Mumbai, while firefighters and teams from the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) are conducting a rescue operation at the site.

title: Youth sentenced to life imprisonment for rape and murder of minor girl in New Town
content: The crime took place on February 6, 2025, when the class VIII student had left her home after an argument with her family members.

title: Heavy rains in Bastar, four die after car swept away
content: Bastar Superintendent of Police Shalabh Sinha told The Hindu that while the call was received on Tuesday morning, the State Disaster Response Force could only start the rescue work much later owing to the strong currents.

title: Assam Cabinet nod for streamlining inter-religious land transfer process
content: Same procedure would be followed when NGOs from outside the State seek to acquire land for establishment of educational or health institutions, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma says; local NGOs are exempt

title: Former Jharkhand MLA Sanjiv Singh acquitted in Neeraj Singh murder case
content: Sanjiv Singh was also present in the court during the pronouncement. "The court absolved Sanjiv Singh of murder charges due to lack of evidence," his counsel said

title: Zero FIR filed against suspended Congress MLA Rahul Mamkootathil
content: Police move comes close on the heels of Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan’s suggestion that the government is on the right legal track on the issue.

title: Watch: Dowry death: The shocking story of Nikki Bhati explained
content: The brutal killing of 28-year-old Nikki Bhati in Greater Noida has shaken the nation. Married in 2016, she faced years of dowry harassment before being set ablaze, allegedly by her husband and in-laws.

title: Eviction drive in Assam’s Nagaon district called off after voluntary demolition
content: Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma hails development; Leader of the Opposition Debabrata Saikia petitions Assam Human Rights Commission for action against violation of the rights of the displaced people

title: Chief Minister’s visit to Osmania University served no purpose: BJP
content: On August 27, N. Ramchander Rao alleged that the education system in the state is in disarray and urged the Congress government to prioritise resolving students’ issues

title: No Durga Puja grant to clubs who have not submitted utilisation certificate: Calcutta High Court
content: The counsel appearing for the State government informed the Court that 2,876 puja committees in Kolkata have submitted utilisation reports on time and only three of the rest 41,795 committees spread across the districts have not submitted their utilisation certificate.

title: ED blocks bank accounts of people raided in Tripura
content: One of the accused is a retired staff member of the fire service, and another is a retired banker. They have been blamed for amassing a huge amount of money and property through illegal and doubtful means

title: President elevates Justice Alok Aradhe and Justice Vipul Pancholi to Supreme Court
content: Justice B.V. Nagarathna, member of SC Collegium, had dissented over elevation of Justice Pancholi to apex court judge

title: In Bodoland Territorial Region, Happiness Mission seeks to heal wounds
content: The run-up to the election to the Bodoland Territorial Council has never been so peaceful since the first polls in 2005

title: Telangana Weather August 28 | Heavy rain forecast for 11 districts
content: Yellow alert for heavy rainfall in 11 Telangana districts, with thunderstorms and gusty winds expected in all areas

title: Class V student found with severe burns in Patna school washroom dies in hospital
content: The victim, a class 5 student, was found unconscious with critical burns in the washroom of the Girls’ Middle School within Gardani Bagh police station limits

title: Flight cancellations leave 30 Hyderabad tourists marooned in Leh
content: “The oxygen cylinders provided by our tour operator have run out, and each new one costs around ₹3,500,” a tourist said

title: Fee hike, hostels, women safety, concessional metro passes key issues in DUSU polls
content: The RSS-backed Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad's (ABVP) State Secretary Sarthak Sharma said they have launched a campaign titled "My DU, My Manifesto" to gather inputs from students

title: Kerala CM signals withdrawal of minor cases during 2018 Sabarimala agitation, but promises prosecution in severe offences
content: People across the globe and the country embraced Sabarimala’s core philosophy. Hence, the TDB has organised the coming together of Ayyappa devotees”, he added

title: IMD forecasts heavy rain in north Bengal till August 29
content: A low-pressure area over the northwest Bay of Bengal will, however, not have any direct impact on the State, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said

title: Rahul Mamkootathil issue: Kerala CM hints ‘government is on the right legal track’
content: My constitutional obligations forbid me from holding forth on such matters or any sensitive information privy to the Chief Minister. The government is on the right legal track, says Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan

title: NIT Calicut excel in national motorsport event
content: The team secured first place in Kerala and 12th position at the national level, marking one of the most significant achievements in the institute’s motorsport journey, a press release said here on Wednesday.

title: DYFI activists block Shafi Parambil MP’s vehicle at Vadakara in Kozhikode
content: The incident happened in the evening when Mr. Parambil was returning from an Onam event for differently-abled children organised by K.K. Rema, the local MLA

title: Cabinet approves India's 2030 CWG bid, says Ahmedabad ideal host with world-class stadiums
content: India is also aiming to conduct the 2036 Olympic Games and for that too, Ahmedabad is a front-runner as the host city. The city's sporting infrastructure is being upgraded with that ambition.

title: Vedan rape case: High Court grants bail to Malayalam rapper
content: In his bail petition, Vedan had alleged that he and his managers used to get calls threatening to implicate him in such a case

title: TVK Madurai conference: Case against Vijay after cadre complains of being ‘pushed down’ by bouncers
content: The case was booked in connection with an incident at the TVK’s recent conference in Madurai, where a party cadre, who climbed the ramp and went close to Mr. Vijay, was forcefully pushed down by a bouncer

title: Heavy rains lash Telangana on August 27; CM Revanth asks Collectors to be on alert
content: Siddipet district too was pounded by showers, particularly in Gajwel, Mirudoddi, Thoguta, Dubbaka and Daultabad

title: Kerala government promulgates rules to grant unrestricted land use rights to farmers settled on assigned land
content: The law empowers the State government to regularise violations of land use norms over the decades, freeing lakhs of settler farmers from undesired litigation, red tape and governmental action

title: SCR cancels, diverts trains due to water overflowing on tracks
content: Tirupati bound Rayalaseema scheduled to leave from Nizamabad has been cancelled for the day while Kacheguda-Medak passenger was partially cancelled between Mirzapalli-Medak

title: Noida dowry death: Inflammable liquid, new video clips open up fresh angles
content: The new findings seem to mark a shift from earlier allegations that Nikki Bhati was set on fire with a flammable liquid by her husband and his family

title: North India records wettest monsoon since 2013
content: 10 powerful predators that rule the animal kingdom How to use Fitkari in place of perfume to get rid of body odour Ganesh Chaturthi 2025: Alia to Kareena, celebrity looks to inspire your festive wardrobe Rupali Ganguly’s Top 10 Must-Have Ethnic Looks for the Festive Season 10 great habits to be happier in life, shared by Robin Sharma Taylor Swift’s engagement: All about the ₹4.38 crore ring everyone’s talking about Saree Glamour: Kajal Aggarwal's best saree looks The hidden cost of helicopter parenting Bigg Boss 19’s Nehal Chudasama brings the glam in these pics Shraddha Srinath flaunts curls gracefully

title: Tamil Nadu CM M. K. Stalin joins ‘Voter Adhikar Yatra’ in Bihar, says BJP has made the Election Commission a ‘puppet’
content: The Tamil Nadu Chief Minister alleged that the deletion of the names of 65 lakh voters from the electoral rolls of Bihar during the special intensive revision was "more dangerous than terrorism"

title: Rahul Gandhi cites media report on huge donations to ‘anonymous parties’ in Gujarat, asks ‘will ECI probe’
content: Mr. Gandhi, the Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha, shared on X the media report which claimed that in Gujarat, 10 anonymously registered political parties received ₹4,300 crore in donations from 2019-20 to 2023-24

title: SC Collegium proposes transfer of 14 judges across nine High Courts
content: A similar reshuffle had happened in the High Courts in May, days after Chief Justice Gavai took over as top judge

title: Bengal Governor removes Gour Banga University's V-C over dereliction of duty, corruption charges
content: The Governor’s directive came days after the university’s inspector of colleges accused the professor of demanding money to cover legal expenses

title: IMD issues red alert for heavy rains for three districts of Himachal Pradesh
content: Red alert for Chamba, Kangra, and Mandi districts; road connectivity between Mandi and Kullu remains affected as both the main highway and alternate routes are blocked

title: BJP demands ‘SIR’ within GHMC limits before local body polls
content: BJP leader Marri Shashidhar Reddy called for strict action against those who have registered in Hyderabad as voters despite belonging to other constituencies or states

title: Armed forces must be prepared for longer conflicts: Rajnath Singh
content: In an address at the ‘Ran Samvad’ at the Army War College in Mhow, Madhya Pradesh, Rajnath Singh said India does not want anyone’s land, but it is ready to go to any extent to protect its territorial integrity

title: CSIR-CCMB scientists discover novel way to expedite tissue repair and regeneration
content: The study has overturned the long-held belief that once a cell begins to die, its journey is irreversible

title: Modi-made ‘MEGA’ has become ‘MAHA headache’ for India: Congress on additional U.S. tariffs
content: Congress general secretary in-charge communications, Jairam Ramesh, said the "Trump double tariff" has come into effect, which will undoubtedly hit India's labour-intensive exports to the U.S.

title: Additional 25% tariff imposed by U.S. President Trump on India comes into effect
content: Earlier, PM Modi asserted he can’t compromise on the interests of farmers, cattle-rearers, small-scale industries, cautioning “pressure on us may increase, but we will bear it”

title: Watch: Why did the government ban money-games online?
content: The Union Government has brought in a law to ban online games played with money. This is a heavy blow, to the industry that has attracted huge sums as investment, running to billions of dollars and which is said to employ a couple of lakhs of people. Why did the government bring this about?

title: SC to hear journalist's plea against Assam Police FIR over video post on August 28
content: In his plea, Mr. Sharma has challenged the validity of Section 152 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS), which deals with acts endangering the sovereignty, unity and integrity of India

title: Killing of journalists in Gaza shocking: India
content: Five journalists were among at least 20 people killed in the strikes on Nasser hospital in Khan Younis

title: SpiceJet imposes 5-year flying ban on Army officer who assaulted its staff at Srinagar airport
content: The officer has been banned from taking any domestic, international or non-scheduled flights operated by the airline during this period

title: Trump again claims he stopped India-Pakistan war from ‘going nuclear’
content: The U.S. President’s latest comments came on August 26 during a cabinet meeting at the White House, where he also claimed that he had spoken with Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: 6,000 evacuated as major rivers flow above alert level in J&K; Mata Vaishno Devi landslip toll rises to 34
content: Death toll in the rain-ravaged Jammu and Kashmir rose to 41; massive damage has been reported to public infrastructure, including several key bridges, houses and commercial establishments

title: Trump tariffs LIVE updates | ‘At the end of the day, we will come together’: Treasury Secretary Bessent on 50% tariff on Indian goods
content: The Indian government is pushing a ‘Swadeshi’ mantra to reduce the economy’s reliance on exports, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi calling on Indians to be “vocal for local”

title: With Sci-Hub gone, will the ‘One Nation, One Subscription’ scheme step up?
content: Internationally, publishers such as Elsevier and Wiley have used the courtroom to buttress the legitimacy of their business model and portray shadow libraries like Alexandra Elbakyan’s Sci-Hub as rogue actors rather than as symptoms of dysfunction

title: Spice trade spurred shipping, colonialism, capitalism; created today’s Mumbai and New York: Nicholas Nugent
content: A journalist and map archivist tells many a fascinating tale of the spice age and its impact on the world through the centuries, pieced together from ancient maps

title: Two dead, nine injured as part of building collapses in Maharashtra’s Palghar district
content: The rear portion of the four-storey Ramabai Apartment, located on Narangi Road in Vasai, crashed onto a chawl in the vicinity around 12.05 a.m., said an official

title: Police issue strict guidelines for Ganesh festival in central zone
content: Security arrangements include the installation of CCTV cameras and measures to prevent thefts, particularly during night hours

title: Indian Army rescues stranded CRPF personnel, civilians near Madhopur Headworks as heavy rains batter Punjab
content: The flood-situation has turned grim in Punjab after the water levels in Sutlej, Beas and Ravi rivers and seasonal rivulets rose following heavy rains in their catchment areas in Himachal Pradesh and Jammu and Kashmir

title: 'Somebody is not very happy with you': Fiji PM Rabuka to Modi on U.S. tariff row
content: I told him the other day, somebody is not very happy with you, but then you are big enough to weather those discomforts, Mr. Rabuka said

title: Ahead of COP30, Mumbai’s Vasai-Virar faces mounting climate risks as urbanisation intensifies
content: Rapid development, wetland loss, flooding, and rising temperatures place the twin city among Maharashtra’s most climate-vulnerable regions, local mapping and global projections show.

title: State government’s invite is an opportunity to fulfil vow to Chamundeshwari Devi, says Banu Mushtaq
content: Active politicians should have a sense of what to politicise and what not to, says the Booker Prize winner

title: What was Tamil Nadu’s historic 1967 Assembly election like?
content: It was momentous as the DMK, a non-Congress party, rode to power for the first time in Tamil Nadu post-Independence. Bakthavatsalam remains the last Congress Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu

title: Why Ganesh Chaturthi is more than modak: Exploring Maharashtra’s culinary traditions, rituals and recipes
content: From Malvani pangats to Goan khatkhate and nivagrya born of leftovers, Ganesh Chaturthi in Goa and Maharashtra is as much about culinary diversity and nostalgia memory as it is about devotion

title: Remembering Vijayakant’s grand political debut in Tamil Nadu
content: At a press conference in Chennai on June 1, 2005, the Tamil actor promised to unveil his party’s name and ideology at the first State conference. On September 14, 2005, during the conference in Madurai, Vijayakant unveiled his party name – Desiya Murpokku Dravida Kazhagam – and its flag.

title: Delhi High Court asks Election Commission of India to consider political party’s plea for common symbol for Bihar polls
content: The Akhil Bharatiya Jan Sangh party claimed it was established in 1951 and was renamed in 1979, and has been contesting elections throughout its existence, besides applying from time to time for the election symbol from the ECI in line with the relevant laws

title: Suvendu alleges TMC MLA arrest in school recruitment scam only tip of the iceberg
content: Leader of Opposition accused that corruption runs deeper in the Trinamool Congress, Jiban Krisha Saha’s arrest only ‘surface of scam’

title: MANUU students condemn FIR against student leader
content: They alleged that cases against him was an attempt to silence Muslim student voices that are critical of the ruling dispensation

title: Dancing Ganesh micro sculpture on an eyelash tip
content: The micro-sculpture of Lord Ganesh dancing on eyelash which is completely invisible to the naked eye, requiring a microscope to view

title: Half of pregnant, lactating women in Bhubaneswar slums use smokeless tobacco on waking
content: Researchers warn SLT use during pregnancy heightens the risks, like preterm births, stillbirth, babies with low birth weight, and small for gestational age.

title: Meeting on FMR, Myanmar border fencing inconclusive
content: An 11-member delegation from three Naga organisations of Manipur held a meeting with officials of the Ministry of Home Affairs in New Delhi on August 26

title: CM calls for collective efforts to achieve ‘Developed Rajasthan-2047’ goals
content: held marathon meetings with the BJP MPs, MLAs, party office-bearers and the BJP candidates in the 2023 Assembly election at his official residence in Jaipur for two days

title: CCMB’s seminal work on programmed cell revival offers hope for regenerative medicine
content: Programmed cell death is generally considered as an irreversible process, however, in recent years, researchers have found evidence that some forms of cell death can indeed be reversed under certain conditions

title: Maratha quota stir: Bombay HC says no protest at Azad Maidan without permission
content: Activist vows to begin an indefinite hunger strike in Mumbai from August 29, demanding 10% Maratha reservation under the OBC category

title: Two more persons held in gold heist case in Arani
content: Surrounded by buildings including a rice mill, the jewellery showroom does not have security personnel.
